channel.title: The Christian Post RSS Feed | homepage
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) Christian Post. All Rights Reserved.
channel.description: The Christian Post is a daily, pan-denominational news publication that provides up-to-date reports from nearly every corner of Christianity, nationwide and worldwide.

image.title: The Christian Post - Christian News, Updated daily

item.title: 9th Haiti Volunteer Welcomed Home as Team Faces New Charges
item.description: After six weeks of being detained in a Haitian jail, Charisa Coulter finally arrived home in Idaho Saturday night.
item.author: Nathan Black

item.title: Few Plan to Invite Friends to Easter Service
item.description: One in three American churchgoers plan to invite unchurched people to Easter worship service this year, a new survey found.
item.author: Jennifer Riley

item.title: Morocco Garners Support Amid Christian Expulsion Reports
item.description: As the Kingdom of Morocco comes under scrutiny for its recent large-scale expulsion of Christians, the North African country is responding with the help of religious leaders and even the U.S. State Department, which released its latest human rights report at an opportune time.
item.author: Aaron J. Leichman

item.title: 'Son of Hamas': Story is God's, Not Mine
item.description: Mosab Hassan Yousef can now add “best-selling author” to his lengthy list of titles, which includes “son of one of the founders of Hamas,” “spy for the Israeli security agency Shin Bet,” “U.S. political asylum seeker,” and “follower of Jesus.”
item.author: Eric Young

item.title: Baptist Missions Head Stresses Need for SBC to Change
item.description: Jerry Rankin, outgoing president of the International Mission Board, is making a strong case for change within his denomination as he prepares to step away from the helm of its missions arm following 17 years of service.
item.author: Joshua A. Goldberg

item.title: Muslim Attack Injures 23 Coptic Christians
item.description: Twenty-three Coptic Christians were injured by Muslim extremists Friday after an attack on a church community center, said an Egyptian Bishop.
item.author: Ethan Cole

item.title: Poll: Abortion Support Falling among Young Adults
item.description: Over the last 20 years, support for legal abortion has continued to drop among young adults, a new Gallup poll shows.
item.author: Audrey Barrick

item.title: Lutherans Worldwide See Gain of 1.5M Members
item.description: The Lutheran World Federation added more than 1.5 million new members to its member churches last year, according to the latest report.
item.author: Audrey Barrick

item.title: Ariz. Church Fights Ban Against Meeting in Homes
item.description: A Christian legal group filed an appeal this week to fight a ban against a church meeting in homes. The Gilbert, Ariz., church was ordered to stop all activities, including Bible studies, leadership meetings and fellowship.
item.author: Nathan Black

item.title: Egypt's Top Sunni Cleric Dies; Church Leaders Pay Respect
item.description: The head of the largest ecumenical body in the world sent condolences this week after receiving news that Egypt’s top Sunni Islam cleric had died after suffering a heart attack.
item.author: Ethan Cole

item.title: Morocco Begins Large-Scale Expulsion of Foreign Christians
item.description: Moroccan authorities deported more than 40 foreign Christian aid workers this week in an ongoing, nationwide crackdown.
item.author: Compass Direct News

item.title: Commentary: Do You Know Jack?
item.description: There are good reasons why even secular society ought to disapprove of suicide. I’ll share them with you.
item.author: Chuck Colson

item.title: Commentary: Contextualization Without Compromise
item.description: The organizers of the conference have asked me to share some of my thoughts on contextualization. So, for better or for worse, here they are.
item.author: Tullian Tchividjian

item.title: Commentary: Boomsday - Coming to a Theater Near You
item.description: It's worth considering the broader question of how society’s changing view of the elderly throughout the years has contributed to this Great Divide between generations.
item.author: Ken Connor
